I have mixed feelings about P.J Clarke's mainly because of the crowd but not necessarily the service or physical restaurant environment. Overall it was a great time, I recommend ordering a bottle of wine and a few appetizers and enjoy the scenery.

I'm actually shocked this place only has 3 stars. I have been in town now 3 nights and I had the best oysters out of the 4 places I went, here. The tomato soup too the people are so nice and friendly, yeah the tired tile needs fixing but the food was another level good

Good, basic food and drink with great views of the Hudson. Not the same ambiance as the original P. J. Clarke's uptown, but not too bad either.

Chicken pot pie was beautiful and delicious but could have used some black pepper on top. More on the basic side if you want to keep things simple! The burger was among some of the best I've ever had simple but delicious! Definitely worth a try if you've never been. Very cozy inside. Linda was our server she took great care of us.

The most amazing restaurant with an amazing crew, Omar the  chef made amazing creations from the kitchen, the , the host tashanna was very helpful and friendly,  All of the managers were helpful in our food and drink selections. Brittany and ND were also helpful and attentive its  very important to be that attentive at a time when people are so impractical. They made the dining experience amazing we will be back...with friends. Pssst the onion rings were real onions with a good spicy sauce. Our service was great from ,Tom Tom.

Friend of mine that used to work here came here and decided to give me a last-minute invite, so I decided to come out and I definitely did enjoy myself, I'm definitely missing a picture of the blue burger and of the turkey sandwich that I ordered but no worries because everything else is pretty much suffice for this review. Definitely a lovely place, service was absolutely phenomenal and everything came in a somewhat timely fashion. If I come back here again, it would maybe be once or twice, I would make it routine. I know they do have seasonal menus so I would be back for maybe another season to try something else. Outside of that I don't have any issues with the restaurant, it was good enough for the time, they didn't have anything that necessarily I would have to come back for. So if I'm in the area, or another season. Then without a doubt I'll come by and try

I really enjoyed my burgers, here came for a farewell lunch and I must say the service was great and the food was delicious. I got the three sliders for my lunch and they were perfectly cooked and juicy. I really enjoyed my meal and look forward to returning. I definitely recommend it and I must say in full disclosure I did not pay the bill. The person paying did say the prices went up from the last time she went. The amount of food was also great; I was very full. My only complaint were my fries were cold.

Walked in for a drink and stayed for the oysters and conversation. The bar was really busy, so we asked for a table which was immediately available and I'm so glad we did. We got a dozen oysters to start just because they had wellfleet which are my favorite and they were absolutely amazing. Had them in MA and they were even better and fresher here. Our server Sam was just great, but the manager Mihai was one of the nicest, most genuine people I met. Very passionate about the food and the history of the place. Will definitely be back.

So so bad! I desperately want to like this PJ Clarke's because the location is great and it's close to where I spend a lot of my time. However, it constantly falls flat. The food never comes out hot or even warm. The only thing they're really good at is getting out drinks. I've learned to accept that you only come here to get drinks and grab a bite somewhere else. The burgers also just aren't as good as they used to be. I wouldn't recommend for food, but definitely grab some drinks because Brookfield is beautiful around this time of year.

Came here on a Thursday night for dinner with a friend. The place had a fun lively atmosphere with the bar area being packed with the young Wall Street happy hour crowd. While the restaurant was a little loud, the dining area was far enough removed from the bar that it didn't feel overly full. The service was prompt and the whole staff was inviting. I got the Cadillac burger cooked medium. While the burger was good, it was pretty clear that the bun was not up to the task. The bottom portion basically disintegrated because of the juice of the medium cooked patty. A more robust bun, or at the very least toasting the bun, was needed in order to take the burger from good to great. Overall it's a good spot to grab dinner after work and asset to Brookfield Place.

After shopping at TB, I came here for a quick bite with my friend. We got oysters and cheesesteak egg rolls. Both were delicious. Oysters were fresh, and the egg rolls were unbelievably tasty. I was here for a quick bite, so I didn't stay longer to order more but would like to return and try other dishes that looked good on the menu. Thanks!

Fabulous marina side dining in NYC! Our server Kimar was delightful and very attentive and caring! The oysters were delicious and our friends daughter enjoyed her brownie Sunday!!

December 2022 - Had lunch here on a busy Saturday just before Christmas.  We waited around 30 minutes to be seated.  The salmon was excellent!  The service and food was great; as was the beer list.  Try it, you'll like it.

Definately an overpriced american cuisine spot (just of the area of where it is located). First, the custumer service was horrible. My spouse and I had to chase down a waiter to get seated. Then, we had to order at the bar and wait the longest time. Then the food came and it was alright. Nothing special. No one checks in on you nor they care about it either. The food and drinks were VERY expensive, it was over $100 for 2 hamburgers, an appetizer and 2 drinks. Might as well go to shake shack for a better meal.

Great location with a lively afternoon vibe and great views but the food was just okay. Interesting menu, but the service was terrible, our waiter was really frazzled, it was not that busy. We started off with some raw oysters. they were very fresh and delicious,  other than a shell here and there; the horseradish was very bland though, missed that spice kick. The brunch spinach omelette was fluffy, Cobb salad took forever to get , but was not that bad, truffle fries were okay. The  disappointment was my lobster roll- decent amount of lobster, but absolutely no flavor, super bland and the lobster itself was a bit over cooked and chewy. I was expecting way more for that price.
Great after work crowd. Servers and bartenders are very friendly and attentive. Nice location on the Marina too.
No comment

Literally an overpriced McDonald's with a bar. The frozen rose, while refreshing on a hot day, is way too overpriced at nearly $20 a piece. Don't get the crunchy chicken sandwich, it's a very dry chicken sandwich without condiments, except lettuce, on the burger. The Clarke burger was probably the only thing somewhat worth it's value (because it tasted like an okay cheeseburger). Not even gonna get into the starter. Overall, the value of the dinner pictured here was ~$120. I do not recommend going here. There are so many places in NYC you could go to and get a decent meal for that same value. The service is also exceptional poor. Essentially, you have to find a waiter or order at the bar. Once they take your order, you sit and hope you don't need anything else because if so, you're gonna have to hunt down a waiter or go back to the bar to get it yourself.
Burger trio and crispy onion straws are my favorite, vibes are ver "finance bro" but lovely place for happy hour on the water
Yummy burgers and French fries and a really cool vibe: would come back here again for the meat! A bit pricey given quality but not insanely

What a perfect way to spend a gorgeous fall day in NYC. Perfect weather - gorgeous scenery and the opportunity to enjoy dining outdoors. High top tables outside and covered are on a first come first served basis - tables under the trees always a bit of a wait. Immediate service - very attentive. I highly suggest getting there early on the weekends especially when the weather is nice. Food is great- very pricey but hey it's NYC. Appetizers are great - we had cheesesteak egg rolls which come with a great sauce. You can't go wrong with the burgers - but we ventured to the Sea... lobster roll and fish and chips. I highly recommend the onion straws. Nice selection of beers and cocktails. Indoors offers a great opportunity to catch a game as well!

Wife and I were walking around after taking the 9/11 museum tour and needed a bit to eat so we found this place thought we'd give it a shot. We shared the trio burgers and a bowl of claim chowder, the burgers were good they could have cut the bun and the lettuce was a little soggy the soup was good but it wasn't a bowl more like a cup. Also if you want more ketchup or bbq sauce it's going to cost you $1 each.

What I like about this place it's always consistent it's been the same for at least 40 years that I remember it's been the same even though they opened up more stores can't get any better than the consistency the service and delicious food thank you PJ Clarks

I want to like this place. I live near another location.  Both are meh. Today my food literally came out not even warm. The re-do wasn't much better but I ate it anyway. You'd think maybe having this happen means, I don't know, a free iced tea? I waited 10 mins in between the bad one and the re-do. I was done my iced tea by then. Never once was I asked if I wanted another. You know, WITH my meal. I know places are trying to get back to speed,  bit a note to managers - including the one who took my food back. Maybe say "hey, I got your drink." Or offer a refill?
The service is very slow, I think they were extremely understaffed. Our waiter was very attentive but had to run back and forward to fill our order. The food was ok, if you need a quick bite.

It's not cheap but you definitely can't go wrong with the ambiance.  We had dinner here one warm evening and the service was impeccable.  Our food was yummy and not too filling.  I didn't see tons of things I'd eat on the menu but it's definitely a worthy spot for a date night if you want to woo your honey.
The place is amazing! From the service to the food. Amazing! The seafood was so fresh. We also tried the slider which was a hit. Definitely a must go to for summer time in the city vibes.

It is a family friendly trendy place right next to the river. It is a great place to meet friends and old flames. I pass by here many times and I finally came here with a friend and had a decent brunch. It's the ambience and makes this place special and we both like seeing so many families and kids around. This place is popping. Would I come back again? Yes I would. As a hungry vegetarian I was satisfied with my brunch.

Took us 30 minutes to get a seating for six on a busy Wednesday evening. The food was amazing and top quality and this restaurant deserves a much higher rating.  The view was magnificent and the atmosphere was impeccable. In addition our server Richard was extremely professional and brought a vibe that was previously unseen to me in this profession before, he alone took our experience from good to amazing. I WILL be coming back here again for those baby back ribs!!!!

We had wanted to grab an outdoor table for lunch and were getting ready to be seated when a manager(?) swooped in and brusquely informed the hostess in front of us that they would not be allowing for any additional outdoor diners due to potential rain. At no point did she look at our party or acknowledge us. We were standing literally 6 inches away and we could hear everything. After she walked away, our hostess sheepishly told us that they could no longer seat us. Which was fine. It was just how we were treated that really put me off ever wanting to visit this place again. If the manager or whoever had just spoken directly to us, instead of pretending that we weren't there and just telling the hostess it was a no go in front of us, it would have been totally fine. As it is, I won't be visiting or recommending this place.

I hate writing bad reviews but I just had to for this establishment. Do not bother, waste of time and money. Service was terrible, food was even worse. The only good thing about this joint is the view.

Amazing salad and truffle fries. Outdoor bar seating is first come first serve with an amazing view on the water. Great service.

Food horrrrible I thought the city was suppose to have good restaurants... feel bad for the waiters they don't deserve this review... steak taste like soap.. like how is it possible they're that busy i can not believe it and restaurants where the food is good are slow... makes no sense to me ‍.... Drinks were mediocre okay I guess

Nice, italian style restaurant. Really enjoyed the drinks (I had a grapefruit spritz) and had the shrimp dip (very creamy). The wait staff was super accommodating as we had a large party and great service. Overall a nice experience

This place always seems to be buzzing with people! So far my favorite thing I had was the short rib beef stew. The meat was so tender and flavorful and is always comforting. It's surrounded by views of the Hudson and the servers are very friendly and kind. I had the Lobster roll as well but forgot to take a picture! It was pretty basic I guess I was hoping for some added flavor to a classic. If you're a purist and really enjoy the lobster taste without much added this would be for you.

I visited this restaurant on a Friday afternoon with a total of 5 people. This restaurant offers both indoor and  outdoor seating. We made a reservation with open table for outdoors since it is located right on the water. There is also an indoor and outdoor bar. The staff was all extremely nice and helpful. The food was good for the price. I personally got a burger and cheesesteak egg rolls and a side of truffle fries. My only complaint was for a party of 5, our table was super small and meant for only 4 people. We had little room to put all of our food and drinks. I would go here again for sure, but not a must.

Decided to finally check out PJClark's the other day. I feel like they're very popular with some folks but after my dinner here I'm at a loss as to why. Everything as pretty average at best, including my burger. I don't see a need to return.

I came here for a PRIDE event ( Drag Brunch) and it was a good experience. Our server was attentive and kind. The food & drinks came out quickly despite how busy it was.

We picked this for lunch based on the reputation of the midtown location and name. Service was fine, but the dish (Chicken Pot Pie) was horrible. All liquid, undercooked veggies and potatoes, and tasted liked it came from the frozen food section of the grocery store. Very disappointing.

Attempted to be seated two separate instances. First encounter lacked hospitality (but was willing to be overlooked) and the second was less than an encounter because nobody would greet us at the door. After an unsuccessful attempt to get the hostess or managers attention, we finally walked away.
Solid service, great location and buzzing on a Friday after work. The baked clams were delicious and the burger is always consistent. Excellent meal.

It's a shame how bad the food is here. It's so over priced for how terrible the quality, presentation and taste are. The bar set up and staff are both great but it's hard to justify going there knowing you can't eat. Be better
Good food and great service from the servers to the general manager (Mazin)! The oysters are a solid choice.
Little overprice for my taste but excellent for bloody M drinks lovers, outside seating is pleasant, not a bad choice if you can get a table. Always packed.
Service was absolute trash. The guy at the bar could of cared less that anyone was there.

I organized a team offsite for 27 people at P.J.Clarke's. They were so organized and accommodating! The original reservation was for 25 people and they quickly added two extra seats. They were very communicative about the pace of the meal, offering dessert and handling the bill.

Every time we go to PJ Clarks we are not disappointed. This last time was no exception. We had a fairly large group with us, as we brought our two of our sons and there ladies so there was a total of six of us. We sat outside as it was September (we come every year to commemorate September 11) so the evening was nice. We did not wait long for our food or drinks. The food was excellent as was the service. The manager was remarkable and can't wait to return again next September.

Unfortunately, I cannot give zero stars, I would not recommend this establishment to anyone. The view is magnificent, the bar was decent. Table service was beyond pandemic S-L-O-W. The food for our party of ten took 1hour and 20 minutes and when it finally got to our table all of the dishes except one were ice COLD, the Brussels sprouts, blistered green beans, burgers, fries all we cold. Clearly the food sat for a long time, inexcusable for an establishment that boasts such quality. This has to be my first negative review, normally I would overlook small issues, but a party of 10 in downtown Manhattan should not be subjected to this level of service. You must do better. After speaking with a manager, we received no satisfaction. Fortunately, Endy Sanchez, another manager, was brought to our table by our server. He listened to our complaints, apologized profusely and credited our tab with 5 or our 10 entrees. This did not change our dining experience, but hopefully a teaching moment for the staff. Thank you Endy.

The management then mansplained how we were wrong. Stick with the Lincoln Center location! So nice, so good.

We've been going to this place for years, both for a date nights and lunches with the kids and family member, the food is great, the best martinis btw! And great celebration for the kids. One of my favorites.

Great neighborhood spot! Good value, strong menu,  attentive service. We've always been pleased with the drinks and food that we've ordered here and really enjoy the ambiance - for both indoor and outdoor dining!
Best burger in Manhattan. Hands down! Love this place especially the original one, has the classic NY pub feel with elevated food. Great cocktails too!

Came here for a company dinner and the service was amazing! There was about 25 of us and I was super impressed by the way they handled the group effortlessly. Our servers were Luis and Khaleef and they were very attentive and ensured we had the best experience possible. I would definitely recommend this place to anyone visiting New York. The views of the Hudson were also amazing on the patio.

It's an "elevated Irish bar" , my handler said -  way nice, huge but not cavernous. I had the fish and chips and the batter was perfect. The tarter sauce was divine, but if I go back I'll ask for extra, I tend to over dip. Friendliest service , where are all these with it young people coming from?

Great place to eat if you want dinner with a view of the water. I love taking people here when they are visiting town. The hostesses have often seemed somewhat disorganized but once we sit down service has always been great. The food is good and reliable. There are a variety of options including gluten free bread for burgers and sandwiches. The restaurant takes allergies very seriously and is very willing to make items dairy free and gluten free which is always a huge plus.

This is just a great place to sit outside on the water and watch the world go by. Service is always at least very good. The food is very good or better. I love the burger, french fries, brussels sprouts and wedge salad in particular. Extremely dog friendly. They'll even volunteer some water in a bowl for your little one. I'm a fan.

Went there for a business lunch and I got the warm lobster Cobb salad. It tasted great with decent lobster tails and claws but one downside was the lettuce was quite too little for a salad as entree. The portion of veggie was almost just like a side. Other than that everything was great. Great outdoor sittings with good service.

Gets really crowded during happy hour. Waiters are bustling back and forth and for some reason too busy to tend to tables as they should. We couldn't seem to get anyone's attention for a longgggg time. Otherwise the food was good. I also really enjoyed sitting outside and people watching with friends.

If I could give zero stars I would.  This place should be re-named "Dine at your own risk Clarke's.  A total fiasco. Asked for a diet coke, was given a regular coke which I drank a partial amount before realizing it could not possibly be a diet coke.  Looked at the bottle and sure enough, it was a regular coke.  I thought I was going to have a diabetic shock, since I have insulin resistance.  Spoke with someone claiming to be a manager who seemed to want to somehow resolve this.  However, apparently he was insincere, because he said he'd call me, but I never heard back from him.  In addition to the coke debacle, the server forgot the avocado and onion rings I had ordered, and finally brought them over, when i was almost finished.  Also I received a salad with croutons after I clearly ordered it WITHOUT croutons.   I felt like I was in a bad sitcom.  Word of advice, servers need to listen to and respect what the patron orders, because given the wrong food or beverage, could have some very serious consequences for the patron. With so many people having food allergies, or medical issues, this restaurant, and any restaurant for that matter, cannot afford to be careless and negligent with what people order to eat, and then be cavalier about it, because it's no laughing matter.  The so-called manager had an opportunity to step up, and should have made some sort of effort to satisfactorily resolve this, rather than disappear and be totally useless, and ineffectual. I've read many comments and critiques here on yelp, where only some get a weak reply from the owner, who only goes as far as to refer the comment to his marketing team for them to investigate, resulting in more weak replies that don't take the customer's part. This is offensive and insulting.  When eating at this over priced over rated, over hyped up joint, people need to make sure they got what they ordered, even if it means being a nuisance.  It's your health and well being that's at stake, not the server's, not the manager's, or owners health. Disgraceful and appalling.

(06-12-2021 dinner)  I was upset and not happy at all the experience is bad. I was actually waiting for my server to come(she never introduce herself. Waiting for my drinks to take and waiting for my food for 46mins. And if you wait that long the food should be good. The food come out burnt and dry its over cook (salmon). My friends are eating aside from me and nobody ask me hows my food. To the point i need to get the managers attention. He wont talk to me at first but i went in front of him. I left hungry and lost my appetite while my friends are eating in burnt food.If someone planning too eat make a research first. And the manager is not friendly might need some training and seminars . Thank you.

Been back twice this week. The Lobster Cobb is perfect for a hot evening, the cocktails are just right-possibly some of the best so far in Manhattan, and the service attentive yet unobtrusive. If you are up for a relaxing, waterfront view of the sunset while enjoying well crafted food-this is your place. And if you are lucky enough to meet the manager, Mazin, you are lucky indeed. He made our evening more than delightful. Kind of like eating with family.

50% of our order was correct which is failing according to public school standards , additional percentage is lost for slow service . Also, when a guy came over to apologize for slow service and to offer if we needed anything we requested ice, that never came . It's honestly funny  and we are in good spirits but if ur looking for a place for lunch with good service and quality food it is NOT this place. The food was basic at best . Definitely won't eat here again or recommend it to anybody . 2 stars because the view was nice and the waitress was nice and her listening skills can definitely be improved upon . I get it though, serving is hard work and being present in chaos is a challenge for anybody . Also, the entire LUNCH has now taken 3 hours . We are still here waiting for next step
I've never had meatloaf like one at PJ Clark's and now I don't want any other kind ever again. A New York classic and always good food and service. They have great sangria, too.
I had the most amazing time at PJ Clarke's! The service was so warm and friendly. I had a great time chatting with two servers, Nora and Pedro, and had the most delicious burger.

P.J. Clarke's offers fantastic views of the Hudson River and is a great place to grab a hamburger and some drinks. Tables are socially distanced and are at least 6 feet apart. Staff do not rush you to finish, you can take your time and enjoy the scenery for hours on end. Terrific place to dine outside and watch the sunset, especially on a warm sunny day.

We came here for a team lunch and it was a pleasant experience. If the weather was better, it would've been a great spot to sit outdoor.. the view of the pier is absolutely amazing .. for appetizers we got the usual calamari and wings, overall apps will be a 7/10..for my order, I ordered a burger with double cheese & side order of garlic fries.. the burger was pretty juicy & quite delicious 8/10.. but the garlic fries can definitely improve a little.. didn't really taste any garlic seasoning and it became soggy really fast. Overall 7.5/10

Dining al fresco is back in NYC and what a great place to do so! We came here today and everything was perfect- great service and delicious food. Beautiful views of Jersey City across the water. The lobster roll here is one of the best I've had, large chunks of lobster and not overly dressed in mayo. Oysters were super fresh and not too salty! Frosé was perfect on today's hot day. Would def return!

Good food, but nothing that blew me away. The  location itself is very nice, on the water, overlooking the city and all the boats. They have tables outside to take in this atmosphere, which is nice. Also tables inside if it's too cold or windy for you. For food, I ordered the Cadillac Burger. My burger came out well done, despite asking for it to be cooked medium. Although the patty was still juicy enough and the tomato, lettuce, and cheese added some moisture to it. The bacon was good too, a too done for my taste though. The burger was thick, so you'll not leave hungry. They also give you a large pile of fries, which are deliciously crisp. Overall, I think the food is overpriced for the quality, but the view is really nice.

Lunch with my favorite Cristo Rey Intern. The service was Fabulous the Food was served fast and fresh.  I ordered the Cadillac Burger and she ordered the fish-n-Chips.
Awesome views of the river, the lobster roll & mac & cheese were to die for! Very nice outdoor seating area with amazing views.

Drinks are a little pricey in my opinion but the manager on duty was fantastic and really made sure my friends and I had a good time. Wish I had gotten his name but he talked to us about the food and recommended we try the froze floater (froze with champagne). It was perfect for the warm spring day and was definitely strong with a sweet taste.

For a  $23 bacon cheeseburger with fries it should come out hot. A ginger ale is $4.25 in a 6 oz bottle. It's a tourist trap. Shame on me for being a local and expecting anything different.

We had lunch here today and from the interior it has a beautiful view of the water. We ordered a burger, fish and chips, chopped salad and Mahi fish tacos. The burger was amazing and the chicken (subbed out the Salmon) chopped salad was very good. The fish and chips were yummy and the mahi tacos were solid. Overall, a good place to eat if you are in the area. It was a little pricey but that's the price you pay for being in that area.

Oh my God, P.J. Clarke's was spectacular. Love this place. I could have ordered every single thing off the menu so I settled on Char-grilled Fish Tacos. Totally delicious. Team is very helpful and will help you with anything. Highly recommend - we will definitely be back to P.J. Clarke's for more.

I absolutely love P.J. Clarke's. I don't want to leave because of the atmosphere. The food is delicious. I have never had a bad meal at P.J. Clarke's. I love ordering Trio of Mini Burgers. The team is really friendly. I really liked that. P.J. Clarke's: Overall it is a fantastic spot.

I found P.J. Clarke's, and let me tell you, the reviews do not lie. Despite the location, the prices weren't crazy. Me and my friend were pleasantly surprised with how good their New England Clam Chowder was, simply delicious. All of the staff are very helpful - you certainly feel welcome and looked after. You won't regret it.
Amazing service, amazing views. The burgers are awesome and the is the perfect spot to grab drinks after work with the views of the river!!

Way overpriced. Steak was rare not medium... and too chewy. Had to ask for water to be refilled on a hot and humid night. French fries overly salty. Not nearly worth the price we paid for dinner.

We were a party of 6 coming for dinner on a week night, and had a good time. The service was friendly and attentive. The menu had lots of options and there was something for everyone. The food was great and I'd definitely recommend the vegetable risotto. It was my birthday and they were kind enough to bring a lit candle in our chocolate cake dessert (which was very large and sharable!). It was a good experience and I'd be happy to return here.

The food is expensive and average in quality. Worse than that is the very insulting sign they put up there as a joke, but it is quite insulting, even if it refers to old signs. "Unescorted Ladies are not Admitted"?!  As if it read: "Blacks are not Admitted." How insulting that would be?! ‍

My partner & I went to have dinner since it started pouring rain- and so did everyone else in the area. The Bar was slammed with office workers & they only had 1 bartender solo on the first long bar. Usually that would mean slow wait times if its busy and understaffed but we saw how fast the bartender was working & customers walking away with drinks. We sat at the bar and were greeted by the host & bartender immediately. The food came out fast! And the Bartender Ray as busy as he was was banging out and taking care of his section, everyone had a drink & he was always attentive. We had a great dinner & i recommend the Aperol Cocktail with Blood Orange- has a slight hint of the Paloma to Margarita Taste which makes it so unique as compared to a regular Aperol Spritz. I love to see bartenders actually measure when putting together a speciality cocktail as it keeps the balance & flavor consistent - and Its always great to see a Bartender keep that consistency even when they are busy. It upholds the standard and a memorable experience. Thank you Ray!

I love this place and always have such a great experience!  The food is always great and the employees are always super friendly and go above and beyond.  Today I called after hours to try and make a reservation for later this week.  Mike, the manager answered the phone and was very pleasant however he informed me that they were closed, along with their reservation system.  He advised me to call back the following morning.  I hung up and wrote a reminder to myself to call back the next day.  Three minutes later my phone rings and it's Mike,  he offered to help me with my reservation because he had a few minutes  to spare.  Who does this?!  I've lived in NYC forever and once it's closing time, people want to get home to their families, pets, sofa's and beds.   But Mike?  Mike took 5 minutes of his time, gave it to me and made my whole f*cking week!  We need more Mike's in this world!  Mike is the f*cking Man!  #BeLikeMike

The servers and bartender were very accommodating, our bartender was great and he agrees that there should be a Peet's Coffee in NY, but I digress, this place is good for a drink and a nibble. Their buffalo wings are zesty, their sliders are pretty damn good after a couple of Magners, and they have Magners. Enough said.
Food ok.  Grumpy waiter.  Nice to be able to eat outside and people watch or see all the boats.
Sadly, this just is not as good as the original, which I love dearly. I appreciate the great view and outdoor seating but there's something lacking in this spinoff.

I wouldn't even choose a star if I didn't have to. I had family in town this past weekend and we went to the location downtown near Brookfield place. We all ordered water, and one Diet Coke, burgers (which I think are the cheapest on the menu) and split fries, and our waitress looked very unhappy about how small our bill was going to be. Granted I understand that a place like this you expect to make big tips, but regardless as a waitress you should treat every customer the same and still work for those tips. I think she thought we were all tourists and decided to never check on our table unless we flagged her down to get something. Maybe she thought she had nothing to lose by not serving us, but what she didn't know is that I live here and have told every person about this experience. Read on it only gets worse. 40 mins later we still didn't get our food, so I asked her and she said she would "check", we noticed that other tables that got there after us had been getting their food already so that had us concerned (mind you they were NOT busy this night). She finally returned and said, "there was a disaster in the kitchen, so sorry guys." So we gave her a few more mins then ANOTHER table next to us got their food and had gotten there at least 20 mins after us. We had been contemplating just getting up and leaving if we didn't get our food but once that happened we decided F it this is ridiculous! We thought about leaving money for the DC but decided that it was utterly ridiculous to be treated the way we were. She saw us get up and said, "sorry guys" with a stupid little smirk on her face like she got her way. I'm still appalled at this experience. I didn't even get to try the food but the experience was so bad I would never return to do so. We ended up going to eat at Dos Toros and THAT is what I recommend, never had one problem with an order there!!

The location of this restaurant is great when the whether is nice out. There is a ton of outdoor seating. We wanted to sit as close to the water as possible so we sat alongside the fountain-type thing there --- not such a good idea when its windy! We ended up get spritzed throughout our meal. Every $.75 oyster special is great! Had the skirt steak and it was perfectly cooked and delicious! Overall the prices are a little expensive and this is definitely not conveniently located as it is so far downtown. If I was in the area, I would go back again.

Best attribute of this place - outdoor seating in the summertime.  It is nice to be on the water with a glass of Sauvignon Blanc.  That being said, food is really bad, service is not great.  Since the main reason one goes to a restaurant is the food, this place just does not cut it...

I had a great time, even though I give it 2 stars. Everyone in the city knows that PJs is for after work drinks, and they do that perfectly well. Plus, you can sit outside and watch sailboats and tourists bob in the water over an undersized $14 martini. Well, the tourists don't bob in the water, but there sure are a lot of them by ground zero.
Super crowded, but nice crowd and friendly waitstaff. Food is awesome, highly recommend the burger with bernaise sauce and the fried onions.

Really one of the only spots on the west side of the highway to grab a drink after work (with decent outdoor space). Nothing beats the atmosphere on a summer evening having some beers by the waterfront. Food is decent but a little over priced. Standard pub fare. Can get crowded.

I live in BPC so I've been here a couple of times. The view is, of course, amazing but the food is nothing but mediocre for the price. NEVER order skirt steak here. I've had it twice, and both times I was served a small chunk of burnt coal, not real steak. Southwest NY, five doors away, is a much better alternative.  But if you insist... come here for drinks, not for real meals.

I like the shrimp salad and sitting outside on the water- I think that the food is kind of mediocre, especially considering the name of the place.   I don't love how you have no choice but to order everything a la carte- and how there are very few healthy alternatives on the menu other than a steak (yes, steak is healthy).
Good burgers and a decent view of the Hudson and the yachts of manhattan's super rich.

I haven't eaten at this PJ's, so I cannot speak to the food.  HOWEVER, it is a good location for after work drinks in the summer time because you can sit outside with a view of the boats in the North Cove Marina.  It gets pretty busy right after work, but there is a lot of standing room both inside and outside.

Stopped by just before noon on a Saturday. Asked the cute hostess if they were still serving breakfast. Answered with a yes and walked away. To my surprise, there were only eggs benedict and a salmon omelette on the  menu. Not what I had in mind. Had the eggs benedict which were nothing special given the exorbitant price. I could have stopped by a food cart for an egg sandwich for a 1/8 of the price and been just as satisfied.

Worst place and worst burger  I've ever try. Mosquitoes flying around, tables are dirty.  Prices are super high.. If I was from health department I would shut down that place for sure... The people goes there because of the view but nothing else
Take your money else where. The food is fine, service was soooooo slow, presentation was horrific. I was served my burger in a plate that is basically used to serve bread at other restaurants...

Perfect meal. When I asked the bartender for Heinz ketchup, he readily produced a bottle. And even though the Diet Coke came in a small glass bottle, he quickly refilled my glass at no charge from another bottle of Diet Coke (multiple times)! Not mention a great burger and fries. Well, well, worth it.

Super underwhelmed by the service.  Confusing layout and the people who work here seem to go out of their way to avoid talking to you let alone helping you.  Very unfortunate as the location is quite nice.

Lots of things to love about this place. One is the outdoor seating. The views of the marina and skyline across the Hudson are great. The burgers here are legendary. They have a full bar with TV's showing sports an news. The seating is comfortable, the service is quick and courteous an the overall atmosphere is cool. I'm usually there for lunch but I'm sure it's great to eat outside in the evening on fair weather nights.

I went here last weekend with a groups of friends for a party after we took a sail ride on the Hudson. We arrived around 2:00 for lunch and drinks. We sat outside and enjoyed the nice view. The service could have been more friendly but overall it was a nice lunch. Very big place with alot of outdoor seating and you can also just hang by the bar inside. I got the burger with fries and it was good. It wasn't the best burger I got, but it hit the spot and they cooked it just like a asked. I would def come back here on a nice spring or summer day for lunch or a cold drink. The other 10 people we were with all enjoyed the food the atmosphere. If you are around this area of NY and are looking for a place to have a nice lunch while enjoying a drink outside, go check this place out.

The location for this place is awesome.  I went on a hot Sunday afternoon, The view of the boats, water and from a distance you can see the Statue of Liberty. When you're eating outdoors you are practically right under the Freedom Tower.  Your surrounded by so much history, it's amazing.  The food was good,  I had a turkey with swiss, bacon and red peppers.  Fries are separate.  A little pricey, but decent.  The service was wonderful.  Everyone was so attentive and pleasant.  I would love to go back on a cooler day so I can sit outdoors and enjoy the breeze.

FROZEN fries with an overpriced burger? forget it. If I want frozen fries McDonalds does it better. Making fresh cut fries is the easiest thing in the world and doesn't cost any more than a potato. I'm not asking for anything exotic. If PJ's is cool with having frozen fries, then I'm guessing they don't care about their food.
Wedge salad good...fish tacos very subpar...wings still to be decided...

First the positives... Very, very good calamari and great service. The people are super friendly. Now for the rest of the story...  My boyfriend hates restaurants with wide-mouth ketchup bottles. They are extremely unsanitary as children and barbarians can lick their knives and stick them back in the bottle.  Honestly, that was the least of our troubles.  In a nutshell, the shrimp salad was small, overpriced and had very little shrimp.  It also has so many slaty olives it's almost inedible. The chicken and swiss sandwich was so dry we had to take a drink of water with each bite to get it down.  Did I mention how overpriced this restaurant is?

PJ Clarke's on the Hudson left us all feeling neglected. Let's start with its pros: a fantastic location, with amazing views of the Statue of Liberty and the sea front. Cons: the place is SORELY understaffed and LOOOONG WAITS -- 40-60 minutes before appetizers? For real? It really bummed us all out. If you value your time, do not go here -- Shake Shake Battery Park does everything these guys do better, faster and will leave you feeling much happier than PJ Clarke's on the Hudson.
The food was better than expected and the view is great. Definitely worth stopping if you're in this part of town. Our server was exceptional.
Great little place with nice view of the water. Staff was attentive and friendly and the food was good.

They get an obligatory bonus star due to the great location, but this is probably one of the worst managed restaurants I've been to in the city. Both times I've gone (once dinner, once lunch) it took over 10 mins to get water to the table and 20 for our drinks to arrive...dinner ended up being a 3 hour affair! 1 time is a problem, 2 is a trend. If you're near the area in the afternoon - there's a couple open food stations that also sell beer and wine that's literally 50 yards away from PJs - save yourself the hassle and go there (tacos are real good). For dinner, Merchants is just a couple mins south and also sits on the water - do that instead. You can spend the extra hour you save pointing and laughing at the suckers @ PJs still waiting for their appetizers.

I like how this is spacious with a few big screen TVs. This location also has outdoor seating which is nice to have in the summer. Service here was just average and a little incompetent on the weekends.

I came here for lunch and was very pleased with the service and food I had. The servers are very attentive and our food came out much faster than I expected. I ordered the Hamburger Au Poivre and it was cooked exactly to my liking. I hate asking for medium well and being served meat that's too red or overdone. This was cooked perfectly and the fries were very fresh. Their house ketchup is organic and tastes awesome!! Definitely a must-go if you're in the area and looking for a great burger!!
